meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To authorize the grant of increases in pensions.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Pensions (Increase) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: adjusted pension (經調整退休金) means the basic pension plus any authorized increase;
authorized increase (特准增加額) means an increase in the basic pension authorized under section 4;

basic pension (基本退休金) means the yearly amount of any pension or other allowance payable by way of periodical payments under an Ordinance specified in Schedule 1 and, where part of such pension or allowance has been commuted, means the yearly amount of the pension or allowance as reduced by the commutation; (Amended L.N. 386 of 1993)

def.name: EstablishedOffice
def.leadIn: established office (設定職位), in relation to the holder of an established office, has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in case the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89) applies to such holder, the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in case the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) or the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401) applies, the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99); (Replaced 85 of 1988 s. 52)

section.def: non-established office (非設定職位) means an office which is not an established office; (Added 36 of 1987 s. 38)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a person who held an established office, his pensionable emoluments as defined in section 2 of the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89), section 2 of the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) or section 2 of the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401), whichever Ordinance applies to the holder of the established office; (Amended 85 of 1988 s. 52; 20 of 1997 s. 20)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a person who held a non-established office, his salary as defined in regulation 25 of the Pensions Regulations (Cap. 89 sub. leg. A), if the regulations apply to him, or his pensionable emoluments as defined in section 2 of the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99), if the Ordinance applies to him; and (Replaced 36 of 1987 s. 38. Amended 20 of 1997 s. 20; E.R. 4 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a person referred to in section 3(1)(bb), his monthly rate of pay determined under section 8(2) of the Auxiliary Forces Pay and Allowances Ordinance (Cap. 254); (Added 20 of 1997 s. 20)

section.def: Scheduled officer (附表人員) has the same meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99). (Added 36 of 1987 s. 38)

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance shall apply to a basic pension payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89), the Police Force Ordinance 1932 (37 of 1932) or the Police Officers (Special Cases) Pensions Ordinance 1954 (21 of 1954) to a person who is aged not less than 55; (Replaced 36 of 1987 s. 38)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.leadIn: under the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) to a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: who was a serving officer within the meaning of that Ordinance and who is aged not less than 55;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: who was a Scheduled officer who was appointed or re-appointed to service under the Government on or after 1 July 1987 and who is aged not less than 60 or who has attained the retirement age which applies to him prescribed in an order under section 10(3) of that Ordinance, whichever is the lesser; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: who is granted a deferred pension under that Ordinance; (Added 36 of 1987 s. 38)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.leadIn: under the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401) to a person who was—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a judicial officer appointed before 1 July 1987, and who has attained the age of 55 years; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a judicial officer appointed on or after 1 July 1987, and who has attained the age of 60 years; (Added 85 of 1988 s. 53)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a person under section 6(1)(e) of the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89) or regulation 26(4)(c) of the Pensions Regulations (Cap. 89 sub. leg. A), or under section 11(1)(h) of the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) or under section 7(1)(h) of the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401); (Amended 36 of 1987 s. 38; 85 of 1988 s. 53)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: to a person under regulation 31(1) of the Pensions Regulations (Cap. 89 sub. leg. A), section 14 of the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) or section 14 of the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401); (Added 4 of 1993 s. 27)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.content: to a person under the Auxiliary Forces Pay and Allowances (Pensions) Regulation (Cap. 254 sub. leg. I); (Added 20 of 1997 s. 21)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a person who, to the satisfaction of the Chief Executive, is incapacitated from engaging in full time employment; (Amended 63 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to a person by virtue of the service of his deceased spouse; or (Replaced 3 of 1993 s. 57)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in respect of a child by virtue of the service of a deceased officer. (Replaced 58 of 1983)

subsection.content: As regards a basic pension payable in respect of service which is not wholly under the Government, an authorized increase shall apply only to that part of the basic pension payable by the Government in respect of service under the Government. (Amended 36 of 1987 s. 38)

A basic pension to which this Ordinance applies shall, in respect of any period beginning on or after the commencement* of this Ordinance, be increased in accordance with such Part of Schedule 2 as is applicable in the particular case. (Amended 36 of 1987 s. 38)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A basic pension to which this Ordinance applies (including any adjusted pension) shall, in respect of any period beginning on or after 1 April 1993, be increased or further increased, as the case may be, by such percentage (percentage of increase) declared by the Chief Executive under subsection (1B) from time to time after the period in which the salary in force is the salary on which the pension is based. (Added 3 of 1993 s. 58. Amended 63 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: If, in any year after 1992 (the succeeding year), the average monthly Consumer Price Index (A) of the period of 12 months beginning on 1 April of the previous year and ending on 31 March of the succeeding year, exceeds the average monthly Consumer Price Index (A) of the period of 12 months immediately preceding that first mentioned period by an amount which when expressed as a percentage exceeds 0.1%, the Chief Executive shall, for the purpose of subsection (1A), declare a percentage of increase equal to the excess expressed as a percentage. (Added 3 of 1993 s. 58. Amended 63 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: A declaration under subsection (1B) shall be made as soon as practicable by notice in the Gazette# and shall take effect on a date specified in such notice, which date shall not be later than the date of the notice. (Added 3 of 1993 s. 58)

Subsections (1) and (1A) shall apply to a basic pension which is a deferred pension under the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) or the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401) with effect from the date the deferred pension is granted and shall apply to the commuted pension gratuity of a deferred pension under the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) or the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401) in the same manner as a basic pension as regards the period from the date the deferred pension is granted to the date when the commuted pension gratuity is paid. (Added 36 of 1987 s. 38. Amended 85 of 1988 s. 54; 3 of 1993 s. 58)

Subsections (1) and (1A) shall apply to a basic pension which is an additional pension granted under regulation 31 of the Pensions Regulations (Cap. 89 sub. leg. A) or section 15 of either the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) or the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401). (Added 36 of 1987 s. 38. Amended 85 of 1988 s. 54; 3 of 1993 s. 58)

subsection.leadIn: Where an officer is granted a pension under section 6(2) of the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89) and opts under regulation 23 of the Pensions Regulations (Cap. 89 sub. leg. A) to receive a gratuity (in lieu of part of his pension), then as regards the period beginning on the date on which the pension is granted and ending on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day immediately preceding the day on and from which, assuming he does not sooner die, he could, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, expect payment of the pension to be made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in case he so dies, the day on which he dies,

subsection.continued: subsections (1) and (1A) shall apply to the gratuity in the same manner as they apply, as regards that period, to a basic pension mentioned in those subsections. (Added 36 of 1987 s. 38. Amended 3 of 1993 s. 58)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Authorized increases to be ignored for certain purposes
section.content: The amount of an authorized increase shall not be taken into account for the purposes of section 9 of the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89) (except subsection (4) thereof), section 21 of the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) (except subsection (2) thereof), section 22 of the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401) (except subsection (2) thereof) or section 8 or 10 of the Widows and Orphans Pension Ordinance (Cap. 94).
section.sourceNote: (Replaced 85 of 1976 s. 2. Amended 36 of 1987 s. 38; 85 of 1988 s. 55; 4 of 1993 s. 28)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Authorized increases to be paid from general revenue
section.content: The cost of an authorized increase shall be charged on and paid out of the general revenue.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Power to amend Schedules
section.content: The Legislative Council may, by resolution, amend Schedule 1.
